familyFarmPage.title: The 200sqm Integrated Family Farm Model
familyFarmPage.description: A holistic approach to small-scale farming for food security, income generation, and sustainability.
familyFarmPage.intro: This model is designed to maximize productivity on a small plot of land (e.g., 200 square meters) by integrating various components that work together synergistically. It's a closed-loop system where waste from one component becomes an input for another, reducing external costs and environmental impact.
familyFarmPage.diagramCaption: Diagram illustrating the integrated components of the 200sqm farm model.

conclusion.title: A Model of Resilience and Abundance
content: The 200sqm Integrated Family Farm is more than just a method of farming; it's a philosophy of working in harmony with nature.
It empowers families to achieve food sovereignty, generate diverse income streams, and build a resilient livelihood in the face of climate change.
By adopting these principles, even the smallest plot of land can become a source of abundance.

zones.title: Overall Layout & Water Management
zones.imageAlt: Diagram of a farm layout with a central pond.
description: The design prioritizes efficient water use and nutrient cycling. A central pond or water reservoir acts as the heart of the farm, collecting rainwater and runoff.

Water from the pond is used to irrigate crops and provide water for livestock. Wastewater from livestock pens is then channeled back, often through a simple filter, to fertilize the pond, which in turn can be used for aquaculture.

details.title: Pond
content: Acts as a heat sink, moderates microclimate, and is a source for irrigation and aquaculture.

details.title: High Beds
content: Raised beds prevent waterlogging during heavy rains and improve soil aeration.

details.title: Paths
content: Paths are covered with mulch to suppress weeds and retain soil moisture.

zones.title: Vegetable Production
zones.imageAlt: Lush vegetable beds with a variety of crops.
description: Intensive vegetable cultivation is the primary income generator. This zone focuses on high-value, fast-growing crops suitable for the local market.
Techniques like intercropping (planting different crops together) and succession planting (replanting a new crop immediately after one is harvested) are used to maximize space and time.

details.title: Trellising
content: Vining plants like beans and cucumbers are grown vertically on trellises to save space.

details.title: Crop Rotation
content: Crops are rotated to prevent soil nutrient depletion and break pest cycles.

details.title: Compost Application
content: On-farm compost is regularly applied to maintain soil fertility.

zones.title: Fruit Trees & Perennials
zones.imageAlt: A banana tree and a papaya tree laden with fruit.
description: Fruit trees like papaya, banana, and moringa are planted along the borders or integrated within the vegetable plots. They provide long-term food security, shade, and additional income.
These perennials require less maintenance than annual vegetables and contribute to the farm's overall biodiversity.

zones.title: Aquaculture
zones.imageAlt: Tilapia fish swimming in a small farm pond.
description: The central pond is stocked with fast-growing fish species like tilapia. The fish provide a valuable source of protein for the family and can be sold in the market.
Fish waste naturally fertilizes the pond water, which can then be used as nutrient-rich irrigation for the crops, closing the nutrient loop.

zones.title: Animal Husbandry
zones.imageAlt: Chickens scratching in a designated coop area.
description: A small number of livestock, such as chickens or ducks, are raised in a designated area. They consume kitchen scraps and pests, and provide eggs and meat.
Their manure is a key ingredient for the compost pile, turning waste into valuable fertilizer for the vegetable beds.

zones.title: Waste Management & Composting
zones.imageAlt: A well-managed compost pile with layers of green and brown material.
description: Nothing is wasted. A dedicated composting area processes all farm and kitchen waste, including crop residues, animal manure, and food scraps.
This creates rich, organic compost that nourishes the soil, eliminates the need for chemical fertilizers, and improves the soil's ability to hold water.

zones.title: Integrated Pest Management (IPM)
zones.imageAlt: Marigold flowers planted next to tomato plants to repel pests.
description: Instead of relying on chemical pesticides, the farm uses a combination of natural methods to manage pests.

This includes planting companion plants (like marigolds) that repel pests, encouraging beneficial insects (like ladybugs), and using physical barriers. This protects both the environment and the health of the consumers.

zones.title: Soil Health Management
zones.imageAlt: A farmer holding rich, dark, loamy soil in their hands.
description: The foundation of the entire system is healthy soil. All practices are geared towards building and maintaining soil fertility.
This includes constant mulching (God's Blanket), regular application of compost, minimizing soil disturbance (no-till methods), and promoting a vibrant community of soil microorganisms.

subSections.title: No-Till/Minimum Tillage
content: Reduces soil erosion, protects soil structure, and preserves microbial life.

subSections.title: Constant Mulching
content: Protects soil from the sun, retains moisture, suppresses weeds, and provides organic matter as it decomposes.

fgwGuidePage.title: Farming God's Way Guide
fgwGuidePage.description: An introduction to the core principles of Farming God's Way (FGW).
fgwGuidePage.intro: Farming God's Way is a resource-saving, God-honoring, and life-giving agricultural solution for the rural and urban poor. It's built upon understanding and implementing biblical principles of agriculture, focusing on faithfulness in management to bring about restoration.

principles.title: No-Tillage
principles.summary: This principle prohibits the plowing or turning of the soil. Instead, planting stations are made with minimal disturbance.
howTo: Measure out your permanent planting stations accurately.
Use a hoe to dig a small hole (approx. 20cm deep) for each station, placing the topsoil and subsoil in separate piles.
Add compost or well-rotted manure to the hole and mix with the topsoil.
Return the mixed soil to the hole, leaving a slight depression for planting.
whyItWorks: Protects the soil structure and prevents erosion.
Maintains the soil's natural layers and ecosystem of microorganisms.
Reduces labor and saves costs on machinery and fuel.
principles.imageAlt: A field with planting stations and no plowing.

principles.title: God's Blanket (100% Mulching)
principles.summary: The soil surface is kept covered at all times with a thick layer of organic mulch, referred to as 'God's Blanket'.
howTo: Gather abundant dry organic matter like grass, straw, or maize stalks.
Apply a thick layer (at least 10-15cm or 4-6 inches) over the entire soil surface between planting stations.
Do not remove the blanket to plant; simply make a hole through it at the station.
Replenish the blanket as it decomposes over time.
whyItWorks: Conserves massive amounts of water by reducing evaporation.
Suppresses almost all weed growth, drastically reducing labor.
Regulates soil temperature, protecting roots from extreme heat.
Feeds soil life and builds rich topsoil as it breaks down.
principles.imageAlt: A thick layer of straw mulch covering a field.

principles.title: High Standards
principles.summary: This principle emphasizes doing everything with excellence, on time, and with diligence, reflecting God's character.
howTo: Prepare the land well before the first rains.
Plant on time to take full advantage of the rainy season.
Use accurate measurements for spacing and inputs.
Practice faithful stewardship over all resources.
whyItWorks: Maximizes the potential of the land and climate.
Leads to higher yields and better quality produce.
principles.imageAlt: A farmer carefully measuring out planting stations.

hero.title: Empowering Agricultural Communities Worldwide
hero.subtitle: DamDoh is a super app designed to connect every stakeholder in the agricultural value chain, from farmers to consumers, fostering a transparent, efficient, and sustainable global ecosystem.

vision.title: Our Vision
vision.p1: We believe in a world where technology empowers even the smallest farmer, where supply chains are transparent and fair, and where communities collaborate to build a more sustainable future for agriculture. DamDoh was born from this vision, crafted by a team deeply rooted in the agricultural landscape.
vision.p2: Our mission is to provide the digital tools and network necessary to overcome the systemic challenges that have long hindered the growth and prosperity of agricultural communities.

challenge.title: The Challenge We Address
challenge.description: The global agricultural supply chain is complex and fragmented, presenting numerous obstacles for its stakeholders.

details.marketAccess: Smallholders struggle to connect with larger markets, often relying on middlemen.
details.inefficiency: Poor logistics and communication lead to delays and spoilage.
details.financialExclusion: Lack of financial history prevents access to loans and insurance.
details.informationGaps: Access to modern best practices and market data is often limited.
details.qualityTrust: Buyers have difficulty verifying the origin and quality of products.
details.climatePressure: Farmers face increasing challenges from unpredictable weather patterns.
details.foodLoss: A significant portion of produce is lost between the farm and the consumer.
details.dataFragmentation: Valuable data is siloed, preventing holistic supply chain insights.

solution.title: Our Solution: A Unified Ecosystem
solution.description: DamDoh addresses these challenges by integrating critical services into a single, user-friendly super app.

list.education: Education and AI-powered advice on sustainable practices like FGW & KNF.
list.ai: AI-driven insights for better decision-making, from crop diagnosis to market pricing.
list.marketplace: A vibrant digital marketplace to connect farmers directly with buyers and service providers.
list.logistics: Integrated logistics and traceability to ensure efficient and transparent delivery.
list.financial: Financial services hub with credit scoring, providing access to loans and insurance.

p2p.title: Peer-to-Peer
p2p.content: Farmers connect with other farmers to share knowledge in community forums and private groups, fostering a network of support and innovation.

p2b.title: Peer-to-Business
p2b.content: Producers and cooperatives connect directly with buyers, retailers, and exporters in the marketplace, ensuring fairer prices and reliable sourcing.

p2e.title: Peer-to-Ecosystem
p2e.content: The entire network connects with essential service providers like logistics partners, financial institutions, and agricultural experts.

p2w.title: Peer-to-World
p2w.content: Through traceability and a global network, we connect local farmers to the world market and conscious consumers to the source of their food.

commitment.title: Our Commitment to the Community
commitment.p1: DamDoh is more than an app; it's a commitment to building a more equitable and sustainable agricultural future.
commitment.p2: We are dedicated to empowering every user with the tools, knowledge, and connections they need to thrive.
commitment.p3: Join us in cultivating a better world, one connection at a time.

careers.title: Careers at DamDoh
careers.subtitle: Join our mission to revolutionize the agricultural supply chain.

whyWorkWithUs.title: Why Work With Us?
whyWorkWithUs.intro: At DamDoh, we're a passionate, mission-driven team dedicated to making a tangible impact. We believe in harnessing technology to solve real-world problems. When you join us, you're not just taking a job; you're becoming part of a movement to build a more sustainable and equitable future for global agriculture. We value:
whyWorkWithUs.point1: Innovation and a first-principles approach to problem-solving.
whyWorkWithUs.point2: A collaborative environment where every voice is heard.
whyWorkWithUs.point3: A deep commitment to the communities we serve.
whyWorkWithUs.point5: Work that has a direct, positive impact on people's lives and the planet.

job1.title: Senior Backend Engineer (Firebase & Node.js)
job1.description: Lead the development of our scalable backend services, working with Firestore, Cloud Functions, and our AI/ML infrastructure.

job2.title: Mobile Product Manager (Agri-Tech)
job2.description: Drive the product roadmap for our mobile super app, working closely with farmers and stakeholders to define features that solve their biggest challenges.

job3.title: UI/UX Designer
job3.description: Design intuitive and accessible user interfaces for our diverse range of stakeholders, from rural farmers to international buyers.

noOpenings.title: No Openings at the Moment
noOpenings.content1: We are always looking for passionate and talented individuals to join our mission. If you believe you have what it takes, send your resume and a cover letter to {emailLink}.

communityGuidelines.title: Community Guidelines
communityGuidelines.subtitle: Our principles for a healthy and productive community.
communityGuidelines.intro: Welcome to the DamDoh community! We're building a network based on trust, respect, and collaboration. To ensure a positive experience for everyone, we ask that you adhere to the following guidelines:

respectful.title: Be Respectful
respectful.description: Treat all members with courtesy. Healthy debates are encouraged, but personal attacks, harassment, and hate speech will not be tolerated. We are a diverse global community; please be mindful of cultural differences.

authentic.title: Be Authentic & Honest
authentic.description: Represent yourself and your products truthfully. Do not post misleading information, create fake profiles, or engage in deceptive practices. Transparency is the foundation of trust in our marketplace.

relevant.title: Stay On-Topic
relevant.description: Contribute to discussions in a meaningful way. Post content that is relevant to agriculture, supply chains, sustainability, and the DamDoh ecosystem. Spam, scams, and irrelevant promotions are not allowed.

fairTrade.title: Uphold Fair Trade
fairTrade.description: Conduct business honorably. Fulfill your orders, pay agreed-upon prices, and communicate clearly. Do not engage in price-gouging or attempts to defraud other members.

sustainable.title: Promote Sustainability
sustainable.description: We are a community dedicated to better agricultural practices. We encourage sharing knowledge about sustainable, regenerative, and ethical farming methods. Posts that promote environmentally harmful practices may be removed.

reporting.title: Reporting Violations
reporting.content: If you see something that you believe violates our guidelines, please report it to our moderation team. You can do this by using the 'Report' button on posts or profiles, or by contacting us directly at {emailLink}.

communityGuidelines.conclusion: By participating in the DamDoh community, you agree to these guidelines. Violations may result in content removal, account suspension, or a permanent ban. Thank you for helping us build a great community!

contactPage.title: Contact Us
contactPage.subtitle: We'd love to hear from you. Here's how you can reach us.

sendMessage.title: Send a Message
sendMessage.note: We'll do our best to respond within 2 business days.

helpCenterPage.title: Help Center
helpCenterPage.subtitle: Find answers to your questions and learn how to get the most out of DamDoh.

privacyPolicy.title: Privacy Policy
privacyPolicy.introduction: This privacy notice for DamDoh Inc. ('we', 'us', or 'our'), describes how and why we might collect, store, use, and/or share ('process') your information when you use our services ('Services'), such as when you visit our website or our mobile application.

whatInfoWeCollect.heading: 1. WHAT INFORMATION DO WE COLLECT?
whatInfoWeCollect.content: We collect personal information that you voluntarily provide to us when you register on the Services, express an interest in obtaining information about us or our products and services, when you participate in activities on the Services, or otherwise when you contact us. This includes profile data, user-generated content, and transaction information.

howWeUseInfo.heading: 2. HOW DO WE PROCESS YOUR INFORMATION?
howWeUseInfo.content: We process your information to provide, improve, and administer our Services, communicate with you, for security and fraud prevention, and to comply with law. We may also process your information for other purposes with your consent.

willInfoBeShared.heading: 3. WHEN AND WITH WHOM DO WE SHARE YOUR PERSONAL INFORMATION?
willInfoBeShared.content: We may share information in specific situations and with specific categories of third parties, such as vendors, consultants, and other service providers who need access to such information to carry out work on our behalf. We require all third parties to respect the security of your personal data and to treat it in accordance with the law.

cookiesAndTracking.heading: 4. DO WE USE COOKIES AND OTHER TRACKING TECHNOLOGIES?
cookiesAndTracking.content: We may use cookies and similar tracking technologies to access or store information. Specific information about how we use such technologies and how you can refuse certain cookies is set out in our Cookie Policy.

howLongWeKeepInfo.heading: 5. HOW LONG DO WE KEEP YOUR INFORMATION?
howLongWeKeepInfo.content: We keep your information for as long as necessary to fulfill the purposes outlined in this privacy notice unless otherwise required by law. When we have no ongoing legitimate business need to process your personal information, we will either delete or anonymize it.

howWeKeepInfoSafe.heading: 6. HOW DO WE KEEP YOUR INFORMATION SAFE?
howWeKeepInfoSafe.content: We have implemented appropriate and reasonable technical and organizational security measures designed to protect the security of any personal information we process. However, despite our safeguards and efforts to secure your information, no electronic transmission over the Internet or information storage technology can be guaranteed to be 100% secure.

minors.heading: 7. DO WE COLLECT INFORMATION FROM MINORS?
minors.content: We do not knowingly solicit data from or market to children under 18 years of age. By using the Services, you represent that you are at least 18 or that you are the parent or guardian of such a minor and consent to such minor dependent’s use of the Services.

privacyRights.heading: 8. WHAT ARE YOUR PRIVACY RIGHTS?
privacyRights.content: In some regions, such as the European Economic Area (EEA), United Kingdom (UK), and Canada, you have rights that allow you greater access to and control over your personal information. You may review, change, or terminate your account at any time.

controlsForDoNotTrack.heading: 9. CONTROLS FOR DO-NOT-TRACK FEATURES
controlsForDoNotTrack.content: Most web browsers and some mobile operating systems and mobile applications include a Do-Not-Track ('DNT') feature or setting you can activate to signal your privacy preference not to have data about your online browsing activities monitored and collected. We do not currently respond to DNT browser signals or any other mechanism that automatically communicates your choice not to be tracked online.

updatesToNotice.heading: 10. DO WE MAKE UPDATES TO THIS NOTICE?
updatesToNotice.content: We may update this privacy notice from time to time. The updated version will be indicated by an updated 'Revised' date and the updated version will be effective as soon as it is accessible. We encourage you to review this privacy notice frequently to be informed of how we are protecting your information.

termsOfService.title: Terms of Service
termsOfService.introduction: Welcome to DamDoh! These Terms of Service ('Terms') govern your use of the DamDoh website and mobile application (collectively, the 'Platform'), operated by DamDoh Inc. Please read these Terms carefully before using our Platform.

agreementToTerms.heading: 1. Agreement to Terms
agreementToTerms.content: By using our Platform, you agree to be bound by these Terms. If you do not agree to these Terms, do not use the Platform. We may modify the Terms at any time, and such modifications will be effective immediately upon posting.

intellectualProperty.heading: 2. Intellectual Property Rights
intellectualProperty.content: The Platform and its original content, features, and functionality are and will remain the exclusive property of DamDoh Inc. and its licensors. Our trademarks may not be used in connection with any product or service without the prior written consent of DamDoh Inc.

userRepresentations.heading: 3. User Representations
userRepresentations.content: By using the Platform, you represent and warrant that: (1) all registration information you submit will be true, accurate, current, and complete; (2) you will maintain the accuracy of such information and promptly update such registration information as necessary; (3) you have the legal capacity and you agree to comply with these Terms of Service.

prohibitedActivities.heading: 4. Prohibited Activities
prohibitedActivities.content: You may not access or use the Platform for any purpose other than that for which we make the Platform available. Prohibited activity includes, but is not limited to: systematic retrieval of data, tricking or defrauding us or other users, interfering with security-related features, and using the Platform to compete with us.

platformManagement.heading: 5. Platform Management
platformManagement.content: We reserve the right, but not the obligation, to: (1) monitor the Platform for violations of these Terms; (2) take appropriate legal action against anyone who, in our sole discretion, violates the law or these Terms; (3) in our sole discretion and without limitation, refuse, restrict access to, limit the availability of, or disable any of your Contributions or any portion thereof.

termAndTermination.heading: 6. Term and Termination
termAndTermination.content: These Terms of Service shall remain in full force and effect while you use the Platform. WITHOUT LIMITING ANY OTHER PROVISION OF THESE TERMS, WE RESERVE THE RIGHT TO, IN OUR SOLE DISCRETION AND WITHOUT NOTICE OR LIABILITY, DENY ACCESS TO AND USE OF THE PLATFORM (INCLUDING BLOCKING CERTAIN IP ADDRESSES), TO ANY PERSON FOR ANY REASON OR FOR NO REASON.

modificationsAndInterruptions.heading: 7. Modifications and Interruptions
modificationsAndInterruptions.content: We reserve the right to change, modify, or remove the contents of the Platform at any time or for any reason at our sole discretion without notice. We also reserve the right to modify or discontinue all or part of the Platform without notice at any time. We will not be liable to you or any third party for any modification, price change, suspension, or discontinuance of the Platform.

governingLaw.heading: 8. Governing Law
governingLaw.content: These Terms and your use of the Platform are governed by and construed in accordance with the laws of the jurisdiction in which DamDoh Inc. is registered, without regard to its conflict of law principles.

disputeResolution.heading: 9. Dispute Resolution
disputeResolution.content: Any legal action of whatever nature brought by either you or us shall be commenced or prosecuted in the courts located in our jurisdiction of registration, and the parties hereby consent to, and waive all defenses of lack of personal jurisdiction and forum non conveniens with respect to venue and jurisdiction in such courts.

contactUs.heading: 10. Contact Us
contactUs.content: In order to resolve a complaint regarding the Platform or to receive further information regarding use of the Platform, please contact us.

termsOfService.conclusion: To contact us, please visit our {contactLink} page.
